intro: Viticella phacelioides, commonly known as the dwarf phacelias, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value. Viticella phacelioides is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
